title: Help making underlined hyperlinks in InDesign CS2
content:
I’m working with InDesign CS2, and the only hyperlink option I can see is the visible/invisible rectangle. I don’t like the way this looks in the PDF version of my document, and I want to create typical blue, underlined hyperlinks. Any help? Thanks so much!

author: jland

comments.content:
The easiest way I’ve found to do this is to go for the invisible rectangle, and create a character style to create the underlined, blue link.

And tag ’em by hand. If you do it as you place each story, it’s not onerous, or you can mark it up on a proofreading run.
